intro: Pavetta valetonii, commonly known as the Malagasy pavetta, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences and are usually white or pale pink. Pavetta valetonii is adapted to the humid, tropical climates of its native region.
